From Anfield_Watch Twitter:

Timo Werner set #LFC a separate deadline to make a final decision on whether they were prepared to meet his release clause. Klopp consulted with FSG, then called Werner to explain why the move would not happen. Klopp insisted the reasoning was purely financial.

Werner accepted the explanation & the two men remain on good terms. FSG do not take money out of Liverpool but they do expect the club to live within its means. The message coming from Anfield has been that there will be no major signings in the coming transfer window.

When contacted by The Athletic, Liverpool insisted the decision to pass on Werner was not a financial one. It would, however, have been a vast outlay for a player who would have started his Anfield career as a substitute.
